intro: Thaspium trifoliatum var. flavum, commonly known as the yellow three-leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
